data.title: Alternative to hotel breakfast prices
data.text: We passed up the high breakfast prices at the Captain Cook and found this place within easy walking distance of the hotel. It looked crowded but we were able to find a table and my spouse headed to the long line at the window where you order. Food was out in no time and the omelettes were great and priced right and will hold you quite full for that long plane ride home! We both ppreciated the coffee refills.

data.title: Breakfast at the Sandwich Deck
data.text: The breakfast menu was nothing out of the ordinary but there was plenty on the plate, the food was well prepared and the staff were attentive to our needs.

data.title: Good oatmeal!
data.text: Looked for a place for oatmeal for breakfast.  The restaurant in the hotel was packed, with a long line!  So, we walked down the street, and had a good bowl of oatmeal.

data.title: Great Breakfast
data.text: We decided to try here as we needed a big breakfast before getting the flight home. It doesn't look much and seemed more geared up for locals than visitors. At 9:30 on a September morning it wasn't busy which is just as well since the ordering process is quite obscure. It seems you can have any combination you want so long as you know what to ask for. The guy behind the counter was very helpful and eventually we ordered a #1 breakfast with reindeer sausage and an omlette. It was cooked perfectly and very filling. Strangely what was described as hash browns were actually country potatoes which was even better. The coffee was good but my orange juice was a bottle from the display fridge. No glass - just the bottle! All in all it was good food at great value.

data.title: Great sandwiches
data.text: We were flying the red-eye back home and picked up two sandwiches - turkey and provolone and a veggie lovers sandwich.  Both were large and stuffed so that we not only had our dinner but an early morning breakfast the next day and given the fact that planes give you nothing to eat, much needed for out trip back home.

data.title: Great for breakfast
data.text: Went to breakfast one day and the food was excellent.  great value for your money, right across from Captain Cook Hotel.

data.title: Heart Attack for Breakfast
data.text: We were deciding where to have breakfast and saw lots of people in here, which swayed our decision. I honestly do not understand why so many people were there! I guess the food is cheap (relatively) but it also tastes and feels cheap. We ordered breakfast sandwiches and left feeling so heavy we wanted to go to bed. I was still disgusted with myself for eating all of it I skipped lunch and wasn't even hungry for dinner. I try not to write these types of reviews often, but I wish I had seen this before we went.

data.title: Great breakfast !
data.text: This is a small restaurant across the street fro the Captian Cooks hotel . .. very unassuming but the breakfast was good! Good coffee..good breakfast sandwich (6.50)

data.title: A simple good meal
data.text: The Snow City Cafe had been recommended to us but there was over an hour wait for a table so we went next door to the Sandwich Deck - no waiting, friendly service & an extensive range of menu options. The food was good & we were out in plenty of time to see the concert we were heading to.

data.title: Best breakfast deal in Anchorage
data.text: We went to a nearby coffee shop that was packed full and costs twice as much so we headed back to this shop.  Was not the prettiest place in town and was a little run down but the food was great, the staff was very friendly and the pricing was the most reasonable of anywhere we were.  Highly recommended if you ain't looking for the Ritz.

data.title: What a great breakfast😀
data.text: Having good coffee and nice fresh ingredients makes for a great breakfast. Three of us had the California omelettes which were excellent. Love the bright sunshine coming in which brings a nice cheery atmosphere. In addition the service was friendly and timely. Nice location just next to the Captain Cook.

data.title: Looks can be deceiving!
data.text:
The Sandwich Deck was just across the street from our hotel (The Captain Cook).  We saw lots of people coming and going so we thought we'd give it a try.  You order at a window and then sit down at a table.  They bring your food to you when it's ready.  They serve breakfast and lunch.

The menu consists of your typical breakfast items: eggs, toast, pancakes, hash brown potatoes, omelettes, bacon, sausage (reindeer of course) BUT it tasted anything but typical.  It took a little while for us to get our food (because the place was packed) but it was definitely worth the wait.  My husband got an omelette with reindeer sausage, veggies and cheese with toast and potatoes.  It was great.  The eggs were cooked just right....nice and fluffy and the sausage in them was so mild and juicy.  The spices on the potatoes were great, too.  I got 2 eggs over medium with pancakes and bacon.  My bacon was perfect...crispy but NOT burnt...and my eggs were perfect...just the way I like them.  These guys know how to cook breakfast.  My guess is, if we had gone in for lunch, we wouldn't have been disappointed either!

Not only do they know how to cook, but they are super nice.  Even with the long lines (now I know why they have so many locals that come in), they were upbeat and friendly!

My only disappointment was that they weren't open on Sunday morning so that we could go in again before we left!!!!!  =)  Oh well, can't blame them for needing a day of rest.  Thanks for an amazing dining experience.  Hope we get to come back some day soon.

data.title: Ordinary decor but great food
data.text: We originally tried to get a table around the corner at a crazy busy lunch place and was told it would be a 40 min wait. There's not a chance we would wait anywhere for 40 min to spend our money so we went into the cafe practically next door. It was near empty which was worrying considering the lineups next door and the decor is very down at heel but the menu looked interesting. Amazing southwest salad, beautiful lattes, spinach wraps were also beautiful. So thanks to all the people crazy enough to line up 40 min for a cheese sandwich, we got to experience great food next door for a lot cheaper. Don't let the decor put you off and you will be pleased.

data.title: Good diner - super friendly staff
data.text: Had breakfast here. Food was great - hearty American breakfast. The decor is rustic, but the best part was the staff. All of them were smiling friendly and quickly did anything to satisfy a request. Overall a great breakfast experience in Anchorage.

data.title: Good food, but long waits
data.text: We ate breakfast here twice.  The food was good, but you have to be prepared for a fairly long wait as the seating area and kitchen are small.  You first place your order, get a number, and then try to find a place to sit.  They bring your order to the table when it was ready.  Given the numbers of people, the gal bringing the food, cleaning off tables, and refilling the coffee urns was extremely pleasant.  They give you a lot of food if you have one of the breakfasts.  The waits are definitely the biggest drawback to the restaurant.

data.title: Came here for breakfast
data.text:
The wait for the food was extremely long. To be fair, the person that placed my order warned me it would take at least 25 minutes for the food to come out. It was a better alternative to waiting 50 minutes just to be SEATED at the Snow City Cafe next door. At least at the Sandwich Deck, your order is placed almost immediately since you order at the counter.

On a good note, the menu has a wide variety of items. The prices were definitely fair and do not break the bank. The food was plentiful and tasted great. If the cooks could maybe be more efficient, this place would be even better. So if you're in a rush, do not come here. If you have ample time, this is a good place to be.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: We had a good wrap and blt. Service a little slow but overall great value. Turkey bacon and ranch wrap. One the best wraps I ever had.

data.title: Quick delicious food - great for breakfast
data.text: We ended up at the Sandwich Deck because the wait at Snow City Cafe was too long.  We were not disappointed!  We ordered two omelets.  My husband and I split one and my husband and daughter split the other.  Both were large and flavorful.  The side of potatoes was cooked to absolute perfection!  If they offered a scramble of reindeer sausage and potatoes, I would have been in heaven.  The restaurant has an understated nautical theme.  You order at a small counter, then have a seat.  We had a booth, but I think they had tables also.  The only draw back is that they do not have a restroom, but will give you the door code so you can use the restroom a few doors down.  Not a problem for us, but on a rainy or freezing day, it would be a drawback.  Our friend ordered hot chocolate and was offered whipped cream on top.  The large soup mug had a beautiful appearance when it arrived.  Pricey for a comparable restaurant in the lower 48, but seemed on par with Anchorage prices and I believe it was cheaper than our original destination.

data.title: Good food quickly
data.text: Order at window and they bring to you relatively fast. Good breakfast food w eggs toast meat for approx 8 dollars. Alittle pricy but good stop before touring

data.title: Recommended by our Tram guide
data.text: This is the place for lunch - as advised by our Tram driver.  It was a great recommendation.   It is a fun place to eat, reminiscent of a 50's 60's diner.  The food came quickly,  our waitress was very attentive.
